explains: n. 竞争中的领先者；赛跑中跑在前头的人

sentences.en: The most intriguing of all is how much of a front-runner is Mrs Clinton?
sentences.cn: 其中最有意思的要数克林顿夫人要花多少钱才能当上这领头羊？

sentences.en: Now Mr McCain is the clear front-runner and Mr Giuliani is out of the race.
sentences.cn: 现在麦凯恩先生是优势巨大的领跑者，而朱利安尼先生已经退出了。

sentences.en: But nobody has emerged as a clear front-runner to take on Mr Obama in 2012.
sentences.cn: 但共和党还没有一个人能于2012年明显胜出奥巴马先生。
